Conclusion: Islam and Christianity look similar on the surface but are fundamentally different. replies.text:
Not that i dont think this interviewer is an idiot, but if you had ever met an afhan or had been there before the russians invaded you would know they didnt want the taliban or that brand of islam. Afghanistan wanted to move up in the  world. Develop. Then the russians came and the fighting carried on. 
After the russians left, the taliban took over by force. They were created in and funded by pakistan specifically to spread sunni islam into afghanistan. The afghan people were forced to live under the boot of taliban rule and it has destroyed them. Education = gone, rights = gone, prospects = gone. 
In less than one lifetime the place has been returned to ruins. the smart people are gone and the culture that the taliban claim is 'our own' is the  talibans culture. Not afghans. The afghans had that rammed down their throats back in the early 90s. They didnt choose it. 
After being tied to the russians and then living under the taliban, there is nothing of substance to work with. Its no wonder we couldnt get them to stand on their own feet.
Today, women in afghanistan WANT to be educated but are not allowed. That by itself ensures the country will stay poor and ignorant forever.
